{"step_by_step_thinking": "Zika fever is a viral infection transmitted by mosquitoes. It is known to cause a range of symptoms, including fever, rash, joint pain, and conjunctivitis. Guillain-Barre syndrome is a rare neurological disorder that has been associated with Zika virus infection. Petechial rash refers to small, pinpoint-sized red or purple spots on the skin caused by bleeding under the skin. Ahralgia refers to joint pain. Based on this information, the clinical features seen in Zika fever include fever, rash, and ahralgia. Therefore, the correct answer is D. Petechial rash.", "answer_choice": "D"}
